turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Spreewerk.
turn.1: What was known about the company Spreewerk?
turn.2: Spreewerk Metallwarenfabrik Spreewerk GmbH was a German weapons manufacturing company.
turn.3: What was the role of the company during the world wars?
turn.4: Spreewerk produced a number of important weapons and components before and during World War II including 280,880 of the Walther P.38 pistol which was the standard service pistol of the German "Heer", and the famous 8.8 cm Flak anti-aircraft gun.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The Berlin-Karlsruher Industrie Werke (BERKA) was founded in 1920 as a successor to the Deutsche Waffen und Munitionsfabriken AG, one of Germany's largest munitions firms of the prewar era.
turn.7: What happened to the company after the world wars?
turn.8: Under the regime of the Versailles treaty the firm was forced to give up the manufacture of armaments, which had been its core business.
turn.9: What did the company do then?
turn.10: Most of the facilities that had grown up to meet the needs of war were reduced and BERKA carried on with factories in Berlin and Karlsruhe, manufacturing a variety of light metal goods.
turn.11: Did the company eventually shut down?
turn.12: In 1928 the firm passed under the control of Günther Quandt who moved the company into the production of business machines, acquiring typewriter manufacturer Olympia Schreibmaschinen in 1929, and opening a new factory in 1933 at Erfurt to manufacture cash registers and other business machines.
